'Ergoline' is a chemical compound whose structural skeleton is contained in a
diverse range of alkaloids. 'Ergoline derivatives' are used clinically for the
purpose of vasoconstriction (5-HT 1 receptor
agonistsâ€”ergotamine) and in the treatment of migraines (used with
caffeine) and Parkinson's disease. Some ergoline alkaloids found in ergot fungi
are implicated in the condition ergotism, which causes convulsive and gangrenous
symptoms. Others include psychedelic drugs (e.g., LSD and some alkaloids in
[[Ipomoea tricolor]] and related species ).
